string-array.name: descriptions
string-array.item: It contains a starchart. It has several marked points of interest in a far-off system.
It contains ancient launch records and shipping manifests for a defunct asteroid mining corporation.
It contains a pre-authorised transfer of several Glitterworld currencies to this datadisk, pending approval.
It contains a scanned image of various indecipherable symbols. A cursory glance appears to show some kind of humanoid lifeform pointing towards an unknown galaxy.
It contains an old archotech schematic for 'Scyther' class Mechanoid Scout Units.
It contains an old map pointing to a vault of silver and gold. It is unknown whether this map is still accurate.
It contains an old research paper on the potential application of mind control with joywire technology.
It contains security access codes for aquatic arcologies of the \u003CDATA CORRUPTED\u003E system.
It contains an old archotech field analysis report on temporal dilation on local wildlife.
It contains a starchart showing high traffic shipping routes throughout various Urbworld colonies.
It contains one large text file titled: 'Designing Games: A Guide to Engineering Experiences'.
It contains various autopsy files on Boomalopes and Boomrats.
It contains a high profile shipping route for Ambrosia.
It contains a scanned image of a tattered document. Of what text is readable, it appears to be designs for a metallic piece of headgear that can effectively lessen psychic effects on the wearer.
This datadisk appears to contain the base blueprint of a 'Subpersona' level artifical intelligence.
This datadisk contains the bank account details of a high profile Glitterworld official.
This datadisk contains blueprints for various types of powered armour. Most of the important details are corrupted.
This datadisk contains various text files. At a cursory glance, the text files appear to contain research notes on UFO crashsites.
This datadisk contains construction techniques for building biodome structures. Unfortunately, it appears they require resources that are not available on this world.

This datadisk contains a single video file. The video is from the point of view of the helmet camera of a Glitterworld soldier, and appears to show the squad of soldiers being attacked by unknown humanoid entities. The video ends with the entire squad being wiped out.
This datadisk contains a large text file. It appears to be a fringe research paper on the application of consciouness transfer into robotic frames.
This datadisk contains security camera footage of a Glitterworld soldier interrogating a space pirate. The pirate relinquishes details on various pirate outposts in multiple star systems.
This datadisk contains multiple executable files. They appear to be homebrew software for breaking through Urbworld security doors.
This datadisk contains a schematic for an experimental railgun-type weapon. It appears the weapon would require a microfusion power source.
This datadisk contains a series of text files. These files appear to be military reports on common mechanoid tactics and behaviours.
This datadisk contains scanned images of common military doctrines for Glitterworld marine forces.
